stimulusHtml: The reaction between a Brønsted-Lowry acid and a Brønsted-Lowry base

features.html:
Directions: Each set of lettered choices below refers to the numbered statements immediately following it. Select the one lettered choice that best fits the statement. A choice may be used once, more than once, or not at all.

The following questions refer to the chemical reactions represented below.

 

(A) 2 C6H6(l) + 15 O2(g) → 12 CO2(g) + 6 H2O(l)

(B) C2H3O2-(aq) + H3O+(aq) → HC2H3O2(aq) + H2O(l)

(C) 4 H+(aq) + 4 Co2+(aq) + O2(g) + 24 NH3(aq) → 4 Co(NH3)63+(aq) + 2 H2O(l)

(D) 2 H2O2(l) → O2(g) + 2 H2O(l)
